description: Creates a limit that manages the distribution of shared resources, such as floating licenses. A limit can throttle work assignments, help manage workloads, and track current usage. Before you use a limit, you must associate the limit with one or more queues. You must add the amountRequirementName to a step in a job template to declare the limit requirement.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: The unique token which the server uses to recognize retries of the same request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: The display name of the limit.

parameters.name: amountRequirementName
parameters.description: The value that you specify as the name in the amounts field of the hostRequirements in a step of a job template to declare the limit requirement.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of resources constrained by this limit. When all of the resources are in use, steps that require the limit won't be scheduled until the resource is available. The maxCount must not be 0. If the value is -1, there is no restriction on the number of resources that can be acquired for this limit.

parameters.name: farmId
parameters.description: The farm ID of the farm that contains the limit.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the limit. A description helps you identify the purpose of the limit.

nested_items.name: limitId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the limit. Use this identifier in other operations, such as CreateQueueLimitAssociation and DeleteLimit.
